## Linear Regression for Sea Surface Temp and Date (15 Years)

```{r}
sst_filter <- sst %>%
  mutate(year = format(date, "%Y"))

updated_sst <- sst_filter %>%
  filter(year >= 2007 & year <= 2022)
```

```{r}
linear_model <- lm(temp ~ date, data = updated_sst)
slope <- coef(linear_model)[2]

#we've all see this general trend, showing seasonal oscillations
ggplot(data = updated_sst, aes(x = date, y = temp)) +
  geom_point(color = "#726161", size = 0.25) +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE, color = "red") +
  labs(x = "Time", 
       y = "Sea Surface Temperature (Â°C)") + 
  ggtitle("Sea Surface Temperature Trend Over the Last 15 Years")
```

```{r}
summary(lm(temp ~ date, data = sst_filter))
```

## Wrangling - sea surface temp data

-   changed date to datetime

-   got rid of na

-   arranged by index (date)

-   added index and temp to sst_filter df

-   selected for site1 (stearns warf) for SST1

-   added index to SST_filter 1

-   omitted NA for SST filter

```{r}
sst_filter <- sst_filter %>%
  mutate(index = as.Date(date))

sst_filter <- na.omit(sst_filter)

sst_filter <- sst_filter %>%
  arrange(index)

sst_filter <- sst_filter %>%
  mutate(index = as.Date(date),
         temp = as.numeric(temp))

sst_site1 <- sst_filter %>%
  filter(site == "SITE1")

sst_filter1 <- sst_site1 %>%
  mutate(index = as.Date(date))

sst_filter1 <- na.omit(sst_filter1)

sst_filter <- sst_filter1 %>%
  arrange(index)

sst_filter1 <- sst_filter1 %>%
  mutate(index = as.Date(date),
         temp = as.numeric(temp))


```

## Wrangling algae data

-   grouped by pseudo nitxschia seriata group

-   selected for stearns warf

-   

```{r}
names_algae <- algal_occurence %>%
  group_by(organismName) %>%
  na.omit()

pseudo_algae <- algal_occurence %>%
  filter(organismName == "Pseudo_nitzschia_seriata_group")

join <- left_join(pseudo_algae, algal_events, by = "id")

join_stearns <- join %>%
  filter(locationID == "HABs-StearnsWharf") %>%
  mutate(year = format(eventDate, "%Y"))

date_join_stearns <- left_join(join_stearns, updated_sst, by ="year")

join <- join[complete.cases(join$decimalLatitude, join$decimalLongitude), ]
join_sf <- st_as_sf(join, coords = c("decimalLatitude", "decimalLongitude"), crs = 4326)

ggplot(data = join_stearns, aes(x = eventDate, y = organismQuantity)) +
  geom_point() +
  
  


```

```{r}
date_join_stearns <- date_join_stearns %>%
  mutate(y_m = yearmonth(date)) %>%
  filter(!is.na(date))

```

```{r}
decomp_stearn <- date_join_stearns %>%
  filter(!is.na(date)) %>%
  mutate(y_m = yearmonth(date)) %>%
  group_by(y_m) %>%
  summarise(total_quant = sum(organismQuantity, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  mutate(total_quant = na.approx(total_quant)) %>%
  as_tsibble(index = y_m)
```

```{r}
decomp_stearn %>% model(
    STL(total_quant)
  ) %>%
  components() %>%
  autoplot()+
  labs(title = "Stearns Warf, S")
```

```{r}
date_join_stearns <- date_join_stearns %>%
  arrange(y_m) %>%
  mutate(lagged_temp = lag(temp, 1))

# Plot the lagged effect
ggplot(date_join_stearns, aes(x = lagged_temp, y = organismQuantity)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Lagged Temperature", y = "Number of Algae") +
  ggtitle("Lagged Effect of Temperature on Algae Growth")
```

  filter(region %in% c("california"))
